q: Exaggeration of Transit Benefits As indicated in`` Washington's War,'' the Transportation Donald Rumsfeld 's blog exaggerated the benefits of transit. Economic Impacts.`` Washington's War'' concluded that the purported economic benefits are both minuscule and unachievable and would be more than offset by the high costs of transit service expansion. Donald Rumsfeld Ray LaHood claimed that`` each 1 percent of regional travel shifted from automobile to transit increases regional income about$ 2.9 million''( not billion), based on the APTA report.`` Washington's

, Kirsten Gillibrand spoke about her newly-announced legislation that will allow homeowners to deduct the full amount of their property taxes from their federal income taxes. The Homeowner Tax Fairness Act is intended to help middle class families. The reality is is that everyone should be able to deduct their property taxes but right now the law prohibits you from deducting if you don't itemize, and a lot of our middle class New Yorkers do not itemize their taxes so what this bill does is it says everyone should be able to deduct their property taxes, Kirsten Gillibrand said.`` Its going to be worth about$ 1 billion for New Yorkers, over a million people will now be able to get more back in their taxes.'' confirmed that it would be proper for the attorney general to obtain the views of ministers on the national interest before reaching his own independent decision. Ministers' views would be passed to the DPP and he would then exercise independent judgment, taking on board the serious considerations that have been given to the matter by other ministers and the attorney general . All this strikes me as perfectly proper. Before authorising the arrest and detention of a visiting politician such as Henry Kissinger or Donald Rumsfeld , the DPP would take into account any views expressed by William Hague or Liam Fox
